result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use or Possess w/ Intent to Use Masking Agent

defendant.name: Clark, Larry W, III
defendant.address: 9387 W Goose Island Rd, Pearson, WI 54462

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:05 AM/ RM 203. Defendant Larry W Clark III appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Case was to be called on 10/24, but was rescheduled for today as Court was overbooked. Def. has contacted PD Office and is eligible for PD. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. State notes only one P.H. can be held with or without counsel. Def. wishes to waive time limits on P.H. and wait for counsel. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

2:04 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Larry W Clark III appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self.  Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State notes Def. is on a probation hold and has concerns. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court considers bail bond factors and orders a $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
